ID: Sun_2024-09-27_ART-VANDALS-Moment-Just
Source: Sun
Title: #DS #NS ART VANDALS Moment Just Stop Oil eco-idiots throw SOUP over Van Gogh's painting hours after 2 other activists jailed for same stunt #NE #DE
Subtitle: #DS The paintings were covered just hours after fellow vandals Phoebe Plummer and Anna Holland were sentenced #DE
Content: #DS #PH #CS Three eco-idiots protested in front of the masterpiece (Alt: Three protesters wearing white ) #CE
#NS JUST Stop Oil vandals #NE threw soup over two Van Gogh paintings at the National Gallery after fellow activists were jailed for the same stunt.Three #NS eco-idiots #NE targeted the masterpiece displayed in the 'Poets and Lovers' exhibition in London today.The paintings were covered just hours after fellow #NS vandals #NE Phoebe Plummer and Anna Holland were sentenced for the same #NS stupidity #NE. #DE #DS Plummer, 23, was handed two years in prison for causing an estimated £10,000-worth of damage to the artwork's frame at the National Gallery in London in 2022.Meanwhile Holland, 22, was given 20 months for the same offence.The protesters, wearing Just Stop Oil T-shirts, chucked two tins of Heinz tomato soup over the 1888 work in October two years ago.They sat in front of the artwork and glued their hands to the wall beneath it. #DE
#DS #PH #CS They chucked soup over the priceless artwork (Alt: Two people stand viewing a framed Van Gogh sunflower painting on a yellow museum wall. The person on the left has blonde hair and wears dark clothing, while the person on the right wears glasses and a dark jacket. Orange liquid streaks are visible on the wall below the artwork, indicating soup has been thrown at the painting.) #CE
The frame was purchased by the gallery in 1999, the court heard, and was valued at £28,000. #DE #NS Sentencing the women, Judge Christopher Hehir said the "cultural treasure" could have been "seriously damaged or even destroyed".Judge Hehir continued: "Soup might have seeped through the glass. You couldn't have cared less if the painting was damaged or not. You had no right to do what you did to Sunflowers."The judge told Plummer: "You clearly think your beliefs give you the right to commit crimes when you feel like it. You do not."Judge Hehir said they "came within the width of a pane of glass of destroying one of the most valuable artworks in the world". #NE Painted in Arles in the south of France in August 1888, van Gogh's painting shows 15 sunflowers standing in a yellow pot against a yellow background.
#DS #PH #CS Soup was thrown over the painting (Alt: A framed Van Gogh sunflower painting hangs on a yellow museum wall, with visible orange liquid dripping down the wall beneath it. The painting appears to be behind protective glass, showing the famous yellow sunflowers in a vase against a blue background. Orange soup or liquid has clearly been thrown at the artwork, creating streaks running down the wall below the ornate frame.) #CE #DE
